website_summaries.verdict: This bed is a great option for those looking to purchase a product able to withstand messes and weather.
pros: The sturdy, waterproof fabric makes cleaning simple and easily resistant to inclement weather conditions
Option to purchase with attachable canopy
Mesh center allows dogs to stay cool
Buyers appreciate the bed's non-skid rubber feet
cons: Buyers have trouble getting in touch with the company's customer service

customer_reviews.title: Great until the cover fell apart
customer_reviews.text: Initially we loved this pet bed. Finally, we had a solution for our Great Dane mix who likes to shred stuffed beds. Plus it provides good support for her joints. However, as of today (less than two weeks with this cot) I realized the stitching on one corner has come undone. The structure is okay, but without an intact stretch cover it isn't functional. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Just Jill

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you do not need customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about 11 mths. The side rail got bent so I called and called and left voice mail and contacted them by form. I thought about getting a replacement bar. They do not carry replacement parts. But she did continue to tell me get a 1 inch pipe to fix. So if anything happens use 1 inch pipe or pvc. My husband fixed the pipe and it works again. My dog was depressed because it was broke.
customer_reviews.author: ck

customer_reviews.title: Best bed on the market
customer_reviews.text: All my dogs & even the cats love it- I may very possibly be buying it again to have a second one especially as my two rottie pups get bigger. I can’t say whether it’s chewproof as I’m sure it’s possible for the suspended top & Sherpa cover.. The frame structure is metal, but does have strong plastic connecting joints. However I have not had an issue with them chewing any of it. The whole thing was super easy & simple to assemble. Good quality at a good price!!
customer_reviews.author: D'Nys

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bed for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: My older dog keeps destroying her traditional dog bed randomly every few months, but I don’t want her old bones on the hard floors of our home, so I bought this hoping she wouldn’t be tempted to chew it since it’s not stuffed. So far, so good:) The assembly was super simple, shipping was quick, packaging was adequate & my dogs all love this bed. I’ll probably order one size smaller than the XL I ordered since it is quite big and the price is reasonable enough to retire this one to the deck:)
customer_reviews.author: Nina Stebbins

customer_reviews.title: X-Large! Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the XL for my Great Dane. This size is perfect for larger breeds. At first he was hesitant to use it but once I topped it with his fave bed and blanky; this big ol baby climbed right on and is enjoying it very much. Our cat likes to keep him company and has also joined him. Didn’t come with much instruction but the set up was pretty self explanatory and no tools were needed. This bed has the middle reinforced which I thought was good for my dog being so heavy. If you have a big dog or a couple of small ones that sleep together this would be your best bet.
customer_reviews.author: IL

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 140 lb Saint Bernard and he loved his bed. We have had it for a little over a year. He sleeps in it every night all night and it still is holding strong! We bought something similar before this and within a couple of months the bed was about ready for the garbage. He doesn’t chew on it but he does dig it a lot trying to find the most comfortable spot and still no effects! I love that it is so light weight that I can EASILY pick it up with 1 hand and move it around or vacuum under it. If we get another dog, hands down we will buy another bed.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Double Bunking
customer_reviews.text: I have seven dog beds in my home as I am a Rover.com host and my dog Jasper (on the right in the pic) favors his K&H Pet Cot. Purchased an XL size, works well for my dog as he uses it daily, sleeps on it all night. Have had it less than six months and the mat is sagging quite a lot. I did purchase a replacement cot, just in case. There is no adjustments to the frame or mat that I can find. Any suggestions other than replace the mat? The photo represents about 200 lbs on the pet cot, but rarely are there two dogs on the bed!
customer_reviews.author: James Chaffee

customer_reviews.title: This item is well-made, to proof, and puppy approved.
customer_reviews.text: My female Doberman appears to love this bed he gets her off the cold floors in the winter and in the summer it has air circulating under her which appears to be nice. She sleeps well and she doesn’t struggle getting in it or out of it. No accidents on the bed after many months. To clean it all I do is vacuum the loose for off of it. Easy to put together but highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Glover

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable as claimed
customer_reviews.text: Both myself and my pupper really like a bed to start with. It was easy to assemble and looks good. However after only a couple months the stitching in one corner burst. The ad claims it can hold up to 150 pounds but my dog is only about 80. I don't know if I got bum version of the bed but not sure if I would ever buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Had animal fur on it already!!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed... I bought this item in "NEW" condition but when we opened the package it already had white animal fur on it! We put it together in our house where we have no animals and our dog outside is completely black. Won't be purchasing again because if I'm going to spend this much money on a new item I would like it to be new. (My dog does like the cot though so it's not the actual product I'm disappointed in).
customer_reviews.author: 0ceanl0ve

customer_reviews.title: Good quality beds.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these beds a large and a extra large for a German Shepherd and a Kangal female that is 125 lb. I am going to order another for our new 150 lb Kangal male. We have used these beds for several years. They hold up really well. We leave them out in summer time and move them to the garage in winter. I have no complaint about quality or workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: don l south

customer_reviews.title: Sagged and then rejected by Diesel
customer_reviews.text: I have a 140 lb Rottweiler, he loved the bed for the first couple of months.. He actually rushed to get in it. Unfortunately the bed has sagged so much, my dog now refuses to sleep in it. Even when I tell him to get in, he does so reluctantly but gets back out during the night. The return window closed 2 months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves her new bed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son's yellow labrador. She is an indoor/outdoor hunting dog. Sleeps inside at night, is outside during the day (or in her heated kennel). She's started migrating to their bed at night, so I bought this so the dog could have her own bed - she loves it! It's easier to have her sleeping inside now, since she's in her own bed.
customer_reviews.author: gundy57

customer_reviews.title: Great Bed
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are a little vague, but if you take all the parts out of the box and sort them out goes together real easy. Will be buying another one for my male as they are so well made.Great idea having a middle support. Only problem was the last corner connection took a bit of getting together. But was able to put the whole thing together while sitting in my office chair. Put outside and within minutes My female Great Pyr claimed it as her own.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah  Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy! Easy to assemble with just one person
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect little rest area for my dog. Super easy to assemble - maybe takes 5-10 minutes (if that). He will sit and look out the window for a while. Sometimes he'll even take a nap. He uses it as his safe space. It collects a lot of hair, but you can take it off and wash it, although you'll have to reassemble it. Overall, it is a real sturdy, fairly easy to clean, and a nice spot for your dog to relax.
customer_reviews.author: Simple Soul

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold the weight it’s supposed to
customer_reviews.text: The cot can not hold my pups weight. She is only 54lbs and when she lays on it, it almost touches the floor. We followed the instructions but it isn’t working. It has only been 2 weeks and a couple days that she’s been using it and it’s not working out.
customer_reviews.author: vishal barmadat

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: We have a long haired German Shepherd that sheds a lot, I was washing her cloth bed twice a week and it still looked dirty. I take a damp rag to the bed every day and sweep underneath it and it looks fine. She prefers the floor but does stay on it longer than she did with the cloth bed. She did try and remove the rubber tag but has given that up, no holes or tears and its been about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dog Chewed To Shreds
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy Tarp and Soft Material. My two 75 lb dogs lay on these at the same time with ease. I have the larger one. However after being left unattended for a few hours. My dog chewed the entire canvas material to shreds. The poles were left untouched. If your dog chews plush bedding. This will not likely solve that problem. Which was what I was trying to accomplish.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Franchy

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love this!
customer_reviews.text: We have two Labs now and both have joint issues. This is the second one we ordered. This bed is very tight which prevents sagging, and makes it easier for dogs to get on and off. The first one we have had about a year with no issues and the fabric remains tight.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Larson

customer_reviews.title: 125lb Akita seems to like it
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Haven’t even put it outside yet since it’s been raining but I was hesitant to buy one of these elevated type beds because I didn’t think my extra large breed Akita would even go near it. He seems to be right at home like any other bed and it doesn’t seem like it’s straining to hold him. I’ll update if the quality degrades over time.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan lam

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean and thrash-proof
customer_reviews.text: Our mini Aussie sometimes can’t help herself and just needs to shake something to its destruction. Having lost more than one pillow-style dog bed, we opted for this raised bed. We picked a larger size for our two dogs to share. Despite its size, the Aussie had to test it. As you can see in the picture, the bed survived. The frame is sturdy metal but almost as light as PVC. (The corner brackets are plastic.) It’s easy to move from room to room. It’s easy to clean with a vacuum, and the fabric has resisted more than one fervent digging by her sister, a blended rescue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: My pets love it so much they had to buy 2! Had make sure that it would be strong enough for the rottie and behold all 3 dogs in 1 bed (220 +lbs). Keeping their elbows from scabbing.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Nice for Big Old Dog
customer_reviews.text: Big enough for 90lb sheperd to stretch out. I added a toddler mattress for extra cushion because our dog is getting old and likes a little more padding. Fits perfectly. The cot is lightweight, easy to assemble, easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Reader7347

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Based on the description I could have went one size smaller however my pooch is a side sleeper. This will fit two dogs as well, easy to put together and take a part the photo is of her laying on the cot before putting it together. She weighs 53lbs smaller lab
customer_reviews.author: Holly H.

customer_reviews.title: Missing more than half of it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and only received 2 legs, 1 side and the fabric bed. Would really love to get a complete bed. I didn’t return it in time but it is absolutely worthless because it didn’t come with all the parts. Would be nice if they would send me a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: BearsLair_Mama

customer_reviews.title: Not as big as expected
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and ordered the larger one for my German Shepherd and Australian Cattle dog, but they both do not fit. Haven't had it too long so want to wait to see how it holds up. They seem to like it (individually) so may just order another one. I like them being kept off the wet ground so it may be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: SUPER durable and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: My two 50lb Pitt mixes and my sister’s 40lb Pitt mix all fit comfortably on this massive bed. When it gets dirty, I spray it down with a hose and let it air dry. Perfect for camping, backyard lounging, or making a cuddly indoor nest.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylynne

customer_reviews.title: For our growing Great Dane
customer_reviews.text: Received it in the mail today but I think overall for the price it’s nice. I ordered the xl. Plenty big enough now and should be perfect by the time out Great Dane puppy is all grown up. She went straight for the plastic part that holds the bars together and started chewing, so I think I’ll get the pad that goes with it for now I put a large bod bed on top. Disappointed that the replacement covers do not come in the xl size.
customer_reviews.author: TanmanMom

customer_reviews.title: The strongest designed dog bed!
customer_reviews.text: We now have 5 of these, 3 sizes and they all are very good. Very strong and easy to clean and service. Best design for any size dogs. We've got 120lb down through 6lb, they switch off without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: CoolTXman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This was not hard to assemble. It’s the perfect size for my lab and her 2 cat friends. Easy to clean because it’s mesh. It creaks when she gets off of it or on it. I’ll buy a couple more of these for different places around the house and outside.
customer_reviews.author: SassieK

customer_reviews.title: The XL size is great for my Newfoundland! He loves his bed and I just ordered a second one!
customer_reviews.text: I bought an XL cot for my Newfoundland a few months ago and put it over an air vent in the living room to give him a cool spot to rest. He loves it, and it is pretty durable! I actually just ordered a second one for the bedroom! One note of caution: the little foot covers do come off (my newf can move his bed around and he managed to get them off his) and there are metal washers inside the covers. It might be best to put the bed on a rug and remove the covers so your fur babies don’t choke on these small pieces.
customer_reviews.author: KAS

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy enough for two large German Shepherds
customer_reviews.text: We've only had the beds a few weeks, but so far they have handled two large German Shepherds without issue, sometimes both on the same bed. I was worried about the dogs' nails snagging the mesh material in the center but no tears or rips so far. Both dogs seem to love them. I will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: MTaylor

customer_reviews.title: not as sturdy as it says
customer_reviews.text: I am a little disappointed. This bed is already caving in in the center My dog weighs 112 and this bed says it goes up to like 300. I have only had it up for a week. For this kind of money I could have bought 2 beds from menards same style. Super easy to put together if your smart enough because it does not come with instructions. Took me some time to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: sandi oshinski

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to set up (only took about 15 min at ...
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to set up (only took about 15 min at most). I keep it outside so that my dogs don't lay on the floor when they go outside. Its not the most comfortable, so if you have a dog with arthritis you may want to put another mat on it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We love our new cot! I was looking for something for my pup to be cooler and cleaner while camping. He is 70lb German Shepherd mix and only 9 months, so he still has growing in him that's why I got the XL. He has a good amount of room to spread out! This worked perfectly! The only thing I would love to see is a set up and take down like an actual cot. It's really easy to assemble, but for transporting, it's a bit of a hassle having to disassemble and reassemble! Just some food for thought :) Otherwise, my Wrigley loves it! He even sleeps on it at night at home!
customer_reviews.author: Cailey

customer_reviews.title: This was a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this bed. I have 3 dogs all over in the 50-55# range. I got the XL so one could stretch out or 2 could fit. So far it’s holding up very well with no signs of wear and tear. It was easy to put together and it’s easy to clean. Super pleased with this bed!
customer_reviews.author: CattP

customer_reviews.title: Durable, sturdy, dogs LOVES it, and reasonably priced. Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is almost 4 yrs old and she knows to chew on toys only. Regarding this bed, my only regret is not finding it sooner. My dog LOVES it!! Large beds are very expensive to find in her size. My Furr Baby is 120lbs, yellow lab, and she has plenty of room to stretch. Wonderful buy and I'm grateful that its reasonably priced. Extra large dogs don't get things at reasonable prices and this is definitely five stars! Sturdy and comfy!!!! #highlyrecommend
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Alves

customer_reviews.title: Labrador loves this outdoor bed & looks nice on the patio
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dog bed for sitting or napping in the shade on a hot day & great place to sit after cooling off in the pool or with the water hose. Our lab loves this bed & it's large enough for her to stretch out on, so we can sit on our backyard loungers together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor cover seam quality.
customer_reviews.text: In use only one day and the seams separated makes no it unusable. My dogs are not even close to being 150 lbs or over. Extremely disappointed! Poor quality for the cover.
customer_reviews.author: charli

customer_reviews.title: ... break from laying on hard surfaces while providing a cool place to rest
customer_reviews.text: Thought I'd give my large black lab a break from laying on hard surfaces while providing a cool place to rest. I also wanted to protect his joints and keep our carpet clean. I was very impressed with this product. It was easy to put together and met all of my expectations. Unfortunately, like the beautiful dog house my husband built, my 90 pound dog was afraid of it. Go figure. We packed it up and returned it. I would recommend it though.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Bonne

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: Plastic frame is ok. Don't let little kids jump on it then it bends! Not as large as expected. But will do for 2 smaller dogs. We thought it would work for 2 Salukis...who have no intention no matter what of lying on it!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark C

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and comfy!
customer_reviews.text: My 115lb Chesapeake Bay Retriever is a fan! This bed allows him to hang out with us in our shop without having to lay on the cold cement floor. I love that when it gets dirty I can just hose it off. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: megan8477

customer_reviews.title: Love this for my babies
customer_reviews.text: Love this for my babies!! I have two large boxers and a great dane puppy. They all can fit on the largest one, for now anyway. They were awful about trying to jump on my bed but now they stay on this all night long. Only complaint is that when there is a lot of weight on it it makes a terrible stretching noise, but I can live with it.
customer_reviews.author: dizzydv67

customer_reviews.title: Didnt even make it 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: The dogs loved this. Unfortunately, the fabric doesn't hold up and I'm a little disappointed that it barely made it 3 months before completely tearing. And they dont make the replacement fabric for the xlarge apparently, not even on their own website. Really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Ray

customer_reviews.title: Not for English Mastiff
customer_reviews.text: It broke not even a year into having the bed. English Mastiff was the culprit. The stitching gave way on All 4 corners. So then I tried to re-stitch and then use zip ties 50 lb zip ties three on all six sides.
customer_reviews.author: dean

customer_reviews.title: Can I get an exchange?  Or refund?
customer_reviews.text: It’s Pretty but didn’t work. My 35 pound dog with arthritis couldn’t step up into it. ( this is probably better for taller dogs) and Center sagged and wasn’t tight so dog was dipping and it looked uncomfortable. Just found box so I could return it but I’m too late for return, I wish I could get an exchange ??? I need something either smaller or stronger in center for when my dog naps out doors.
customer_reviews.author: Ileana D.

customer_reviews.title: Ancient German Shepherd likes it
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to disassemble to clean frequently. Our ancient German Shepherd was unsure of it for a few days, but now he loves it. Makes a huge difference in the amount he pants even in the AC here in Florida.
customer_reviews.author: patricia a knigge

customer_reviews.title: Great Dane approved!
customer_reviews.text: I got the largest size for my Great Dane who’s 129 lbs and it’s a perfect fit. Took my pup a bit to warm up to the cot (I think she thought it looked unstable) but once she figured out it wouldn’t tip over when she got on there, she loved it! Really easy to assemble as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Marks

customer_reviews.title: He loves ot!
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than expected he's 85lbs. Easy to put together and he likes it! I thought with him getting older being up off the ground would be good . He seems to like the hammock effect. Very happy with my purchase. And it got here early!
customer_reviews.author: Gina Reid

customer_reviews.title: middle bar doesn't touch until dogs are on it.
customer_reviews.text: Had a bit of trouble with the middle bar and the people at K&H are great. I finally figured out the middle bar doesn't hit the floor until there is a good bit of weight on it. My pups love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Morrissey

customer_reviews.title: Bed is easy to clean and after a few hours out in ...
customer_reviews.text: My 130lb Weimaraner loves this bed. He’s an outside dog and can get a little stinky. Bed is easy to clean and after a few hours out in the sun, doesn’t stink. I would definitely recommend this bed.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold up well for heavy or multiple dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This cot was a great investment but am sad to say that it did not hold up as well as it described, a seem ripped already and we haven’t hit the 6 month period yet. Super sad about this, our senior dog loves to spend more of his time outside in the cot and now it’s ripped.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Get chu one
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, dog loves it. Doesn't absorb dog funk.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: The XL is great for 100lb pup
customer_reviews.text: 115lb dog and he absolutely lives the XL size. Very simple to assemble. Not sure it would fit two dogs...but two smaller ones I could see. We keep it on our patio and its kept up so far with all the weather
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great large size, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Great size for a large dog to sleep comfortably on. Dog loves it. I was a little disappointed that the corners are plastic because I could see this dog laying there chewing on the corners... but he hasn’t yet:)))
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer, Rose

customer_reviews.title: Love This
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble. Very roomy. At least 4 small dogs fit easily on the X-Large. Should've gotten this sooner. Keeps dogs off the ground and seems to be very comfortable for them.
customer_reviews.author: Coni Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Holds a giant malamute!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 160lb Alaskan malamute and this bed passes the durability test! He runs and jumps up on it all the time and it holds up! It was love at first site for him too! He sleeps on it all the time and loves his new bed. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Jessi May

customer_reviews.title: I’ve been searching for one of these since last summer ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been searching for one of these since last summer but never found one that would accommodate my 160lb dog til now. The concrete around our pool is way too hot for him to lay on and he loves to be right there when we’re in the pool, now he can do it in comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Pritchett

customer_reviews.title: I love this for my large German Shpherd
customer_reviews.text: I love this for my large German Shpherd. It’s also perfect for him while he is house training he’s 8 months old. It’s stable and comfortable! Easy to clean too!
customer_reviews.author: S. Gascon

customer_reviews.title: It was super easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: It was super easy to put together! Thanks for that. Easier than the kuranda and coolaroo (screwdriver needed and loosens over time). It looks great and I love the mesh. The legs are plastic which is fine by me for outside use. The dogs will love to sun on it
customer_reviews.author: TAS ATL

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for 100lb German Shepherd
customer_reviews.text: I was looking every where for a bed like this, but only came in large, I wanted something bigger (X-large) for my 100lb Shepherd, it was perfect 👌🏼 there was even room for him to stretch, I would recommend for large dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Gloryaa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and size
customer_reviews.text: The material is durable and has smooth feel. This was very easy to put together and size perfect for a large german shepherd. Our dog also cant bite this cot either very tight .
customer_reviews.author: Anne alicia

customer_reviews.title: Returning for replacement, after a week of use coming ...
customer_reviews.text: Returning for replacement, after a week of use coming apart at the seem. My dog is not even 150 pounds. Which the box says for up typ 300lbs.
customer_reviews.author: JACKIE CORNEZ

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but my dogs did not desire the beds.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are 113 and 118 lbs and they both did not like the elevated beds. Quality seems to be good but the comfort ability aspect of the beds are not desired by my dogs. One is a Block head Chocolate lab and the other is a Mastiff mix.
customer_reviews.author: DLP L

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material. Fell apart
customer_reviews.text: One very gentle Golden retriever lays on it. It has fallen apart. The dog did not chew, as you see there's no sign of chewing, it couldn't take the weight and it started to brake.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bed
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. However, it’s difficult to clean for long haired dogs. Lightweight, but sturdy. Much better than a previous purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Nice material
customer_reviews.text: Great size for a short but very heavy dog. He weighs about 75lbs so it does sag when he lays on it but that’s to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Super Durable for my pup.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Used outside and in. My dog is 96lbs and enjoys it. Im shocked he hasn’t chewed it up yet, but it’s still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: FieryPhoenix

customer_reviews.title: Buy it if your dogs loves to lay on something
customer_reviews.text: This product was amazing! My German Shepherd enjoyed it when we were camping. She didn't have to lay on the dirt. Less than 5 minutes to assemble. I would recommend buying this if your dog typically likes laying down on something. My male german shepherd prefers floor so he did not use the extra one I bought. I purchased the X-large dog bed. It was HUGE! Easy to store and put away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy bed
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. It arrived and was easy to assemble. It's very sturdy and my dog loves it! She's 55 lbs right now and the bed has space for her to grow into.
customer_reviews.author: britt mo

customer_reviews.title: extremely poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Within 48 hours, the stitching had unraveled and it fell apart. My dog weighs 48 lbs, which is less than half of the weight restriction. This is the worst product I have ever purchased on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: Received promptly & easy to put together, took about 5 mins. The challenge is the bottom middle bar & not getting pinched. So far, a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney I

customer_reviews.title: Doggy loves it
customer_reviews.text: I have a 110 lb labrador, he loves this. It was very simple to put together, and it is very light so easy to move.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Durable pet cots for 5 months and counting
customer_reviews.text: I bought two XL pet cots for my two mastiffs who weigh about 150lbs each. They have held up well for over 5 months now.
customer_reviews.author: CWA

customer_reviews.title: Broke after two months
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product since September and the threads have already come completely loose on one side! The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars is because my dog loved it. :(
customer_reviews.author: Lori Daughtry

customer_reviews.title: easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I have had many brands over the years. This was by far the easiest to put together. Had a minor problem with one corner. Rapid response from customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Toby L. Brandtman

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this bed did not hold up for a year. My dogs are 20 and 90 lbs. The bed ripped after 8 months.
customer_reviews.author: dogmom

customer_reviews.title: Great, even for the bigger dogs!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Both my Great Dane and Boxer mix LOVE them. For the Great Dane we ordered a XL and for our smaller pup we ordered a large. These both were very easy to put together (my 8 year old actually did one while I did the other) Overall I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Albena

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Dog chewed apart, not easy to clean as dog hair does not was wash off.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Maultsby

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the dogs off the dirt, they love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, good size for large dog, keeps them clean off the grass and dirt, they love to lounge on the sturdy easy to clean cots.
customer_reviews.author: Sala Upp

customer_reviews.title: Made very well.
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 dogs, 50lbs, 80lbs and 110 plus. They all love the beds. Heck even the cat loves the beds. I got three extra large and they are great size and made very well. Have had them for about a month now and no issues. Would recommend this bed and would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Dog approved.
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs take destroying furniture very seriously. We've had this for about a week, and it's still in one piece. I would say our dogs are medium to large dogs and they share the XL cot happily. We will purchase another one for the other room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely durable for big dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is our 1st experience with this particular bed. But 3rd purchase of an elevated bed for our 170lb Mastiff. So impressed with the quality and structure of this bed. For the price, I can't believe how well it's put together! Will purchase again if our dog manages to break/wear out this one too:)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plenty big enough
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 big Pitts and this was perfect for my mud room they stay in when i leave, its big enough for both of them to lay on comfortably, hell I can fit on this thing at 5'2" 😂
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlynicole

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy dog bed
customer_reviews.text: Complicated to put together but very sturdy. My two Yorkies love it.
customer_reviews.author: norma moses

customer_reviews.title: Like this cot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my lab had developed pressure sores. He loves the cot. I also take it to boarding because they don't take them outside enough there, this keeps them off the floor and out of urine.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie K.

customer_reviews.title: Needs better stitiching
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say the cot material didn’t wear well and stitching came undone easily.. just needs better stitiching ... for the price it’s good for short term use
customer_reviews.author: The Awesome Pawsome

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: Only gave a 4 star bc it is sagging a little after only a month of use. Both our medium sized dogs fit wonderfully on it though.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Solid Beds
customer_reviews.text: I've read other reviews on here about the strength and durability, I have four of these and they are holding up very well! The first two I bought were actually too small for my two 115# GSD's. We use the small ones in the garage and even though they aren't big enough, no problems. The larger ones are in the house and get more mileage, they are holding up well too.I also power wash these every weekend without worry. My dogs and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lawther

customer_reviews.title: dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: I put a pillow dog bed on top, the bed is big, but the dogs like to sprawl out so they take turns napping on it, or I should say fight over it. I might purchase another one but don't really have the room. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy M.

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs LOVE their cot.
customer_reviews.text: Both our dogs love their cot! Good build quality. I will buy more as our dogs get bigger and can no longer share the 1.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bed for our 80 pound shepherd who has eaten and destroyed Every dog bed we have bought.he loves the bed. Very sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought it was great! It didn’t last a month and it tore from one side. All the legs were intact not bent or scratched. The trampoline part is what ripped. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Jorge A.

customer_reviews.title: Almost a good product
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love it! But, after only 4 months of use the item severely sags in the middle, and the seam is coming apart on one. This is the XL Large and cannot find a replacement cover piece.
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: My Goldendoodle loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 80+ pound 11 month old goldendoodle loves this cot. Durable and comfortable. If it wears out I will buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Bird Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money at all
customer_reviews.text: Plastic legs don’t do well with a dog that chews, one day in the kennel and now it’s in the trash
customer_reviews.author: K Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: happy dogs
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 dogs (around 80 lbs ea) and on occasion they both lay on the bed. The middle support is great for this and the fabric seems to be holding up very well. Much sturdier than other similar beds we've had.
customer_reviews.author: LCM1964

customer_reviews.title: Must have.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 9 year old lab. Every morning he would struggle to get up of the hard floor. The first couple of days we notice the difference. He would jump of his cot like he had a great night sleep. He is always on it. Now the cat just sits on there all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Felix S.

customer_reviews.title: My dogs live it so far. Got it today ...
customer_reviews.text: My dogs like it so far. Got it today. Was a little interesting not to see any assemble instructions, but was able to figure it out. Please refer to my photo for assembly help
customer_reviews.author: NEXTechGURU

customer_reviews.title: My dogs LOVE this bed
customer_reviews.text: My dogs LOVE this bed. We use it outside on our back deck, so they can sunbathe without laying on the deck. Fits at least 2 Boston Terriers, and sometimes all 3.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle D

product_meta.title: K&H Pet Products Original Pet Cot Elevated Dog Bed Chocolate/Black Mesh X-Large 32 X 50 X 9 Inches
product_meta.description: The K&H Pet Cot elevates your pet off the ground allowing air to flow around your pet to keep them cool. The easy to assemble K&H Pet Cot requires no tools! Can be disassembled and taken anywhere. Great for camping, hiking, picnics or anywhere at home inside or out. Made with water resistant, 600 denier fabric and a breathable mesh center which repels moisture, mold, mildew, bacteria and odors. Slip resistant rubber feet help protect floor surfaces. The K&H Pet Cot is durable and can hold up to 200 pounds. Indoor or outdoor use. Available in multiple sizes and colors.
feature_bullets: Dog cot made of waterproof, 600-denier fabric
Raised dog bed helps pets stay cool with its mesh center
Durable & tested for strength, holds up to 200 pounds
Simple, tool-free assembly with non-skid rubber feet
If you have questions, please contact us at 1-877-738-5188
